attributes.action: implement and enforce a new set of rules for managing the expenses of Members of Parliament.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
-Detailed audit trails of all  claims, with supporting receipts. 
-Strict limits on what can be classed as a Second/Main Home including minimim periods  each  MP actually resides in each home per year.  
-An end to 'Flipping' when the MP is able to redefine their Second Home for 
    short-term gain.. 
-A replacement of the  Second Home Allowance such as 
     - Providing basic hotel accommodation in London.
    -  Providing a fixed financial allowance equivalent to basic hotel accommodation    -  - -Providing a Home  paid for by the Taxpayer but wholly owned by the Taxpayer with no profit to the MP concerned 
 - Where two or more MPs are living as a family  then the new mechanism must ensure
    that their allowances take this into account (e.g. their claims must use the same definition of Second/Main home) and not double-claim the same expense. 
-Ensure that independent accounting,  governance of claims and payments is enforced 
- Ensure that MPs comply with the standard taxation rules on payments and expenses applied to all other UK employees by 
    the Inland Revenue.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
